trans-unit.source: Represents a fault that can have an associated HTTP status code.

When using a WCF REST endpoint (<xref:System.ServiceModel.WebHttpBinding> and <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.WebHttpBehavior> or <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.WebScriptEnablingBehavior>) the HTTP status code on the response is set accordingly.
However, <xref:System.ServiceModel.Web.WebFaultException> can be used with non-REST endpoints and behaves like a regular <xref:System.ServiceModel.FaultException>.
Use this class to return error details using the same format as the operation.
The serializable error detail type.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Web.WebFaultException`1"></xref> class with the specified <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo"></xref> and <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext"></xref>
The serialization info.
The streaming context.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Web.WebFaultException`1"></xref> class with the specified exception detail and the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Web.WebFaultException.#ctor(System.Net.HttpStatusCode)"></xref> to return to the caller.
The fault.
The HTTP status code to set on the response message.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Web.WebFaultException`1"></xref> class with the specified exception detail and the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Web.WebFaultException`1.StatusCode"></xref> to return to the caller.
The fault.
The HTTP status code to set on the response message.
The set of known types that are used for serialization and deserialization.

An implementation of the <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.ISerializable.GetObjectData(System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo,System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext)"></xref> method that is called when an object is serialized to a stream.
The serialization information to which the object data is added when serialized.
The destination for the serialized object.
Gets the <xref href="System.Net.HttpStatusCode"></xref> associated with the fault.
The HTTP status code associated with the fault.
